page.title: 09HACKLINGE AREA HOME LIFE
page.content: Most families prefer plain English food, some eat foreign foods occasion- ally. All have gardens and most grow some vegetables and fruit and freeze any surplus. Some convenience food is used. Bread and milk are delivered everywhere. Each home has a television refrigerator and washing machine. Most families keep pets, dogs, cats, and some rabbits. On special occasions people go out for a meal or entertain at home. Holidays are usually taken in this country. A few travel abroad and Day Trips to France are popular. Two Public Houses, The Blazing Donkey at Ham and The Coach and Horses at Burgess Green serve bar snacks and evening meals. The licensing authority is at Dover.
